metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36369 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Dropbear through 2020.81. Due to a non-RFC-compliant check of the available authentication methods in the client-side SSH code, it is possible for an SSH server to change the login process in its favor. This attack can bypass additional security measures such as FIDO2 tokens or SSH-Askpass. Thus, it allows an attacker to abuse a forwarded agent for logging on to another server unnoticed.

criterions.comment: dropbear: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
